channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Covid: Germany fears thousands got saline, not vaccine from nurse
item.description: More than 8,000 mostly elderly people are urged to get vaccinated again as a nurse is questioned.

item.title: Italy may have registered Europe's hottest temperature on record
item.description: If the registered reading is verified, it will be hottest temperature ever recorded in Europe.

item.title: Russia holds hypersonic flight expert in spy probe
item.description: Alexander Kuranov, detained by FSB agents, runs a team of pioneering spaceflight researchers.

item.title: Turkish capital reels from violent protests against Syrians
item.description: Protesters attacked houses owned by Syrians after tensions flared over reports of a fatal stabbing.

item.title: UK and Russia ambassadors anger Iran by restaging WWII image
item.description: Iran condemns an "inappropriate" image of the UK and Russian ambassadors recreating a wartime image.

item.title: Wagner: Gaddafi's son faces arrest over Russian mercenaries
item.description: A warrant is issued against Saif al-Islam Gaddafi after a BBC investigation into mercenaries in Libya.

item.title: Messi: What are the PSG fan tokens given to the footballer?
item.description: Paris St-Germain has given Messi a "large number" of fan tokens as part of his welcome package.

item.title: Berlin embassy arrest: A case of old-school spying?
item.description: Why nothing in the case of the arrest of a man at the British Embassy in Berlin should surprise us.

item.title: Picasso masterpieces to go on sale in blockbuster auction
item.description: Proceeds could reach $100m in what is thought to be the most valuable auction of the artist's works.

item.title: Kiwi Chow: The filmmaker who took Hong Kong's protests to Cannes
item.description: Kiwi Chow's documentary was a surprise at the film festival - and it has a controversial title.

item.title: Half a million EU citizens await decision over right to stay in UK
item.description: More than half a million EU citizens who have applied for settled status in the UK await a decision.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libyaâ€™s war.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.
